conclusion: To determine the amount of heat exchanged, analyze each segment of the cycle using the first law of thermodynamics.
Segment AB is an isochoric process with constant volume V = V1 and pressure changes from P1 to P2.
For an isochoric process, work done W_AB = 0.
Using the ideal gas law, T_B = (P2/P1) T0.
Change in internal energy ΔU_AB = nC_V T0 (P2/P1 - 1).
Heat added Q_AB = ΔU_AB = nC_V T0 (P2/P1 - 1).
Segment BC is an isobaric process with constant pressure P = P2 and volume changes from V1 to V2.
Work done by the gas W_BC = P2 (V2 - V1).
Using the ideal gas law, T_C = (V2/V1) (P2/P1) T0.
Change in internal energy ΔU_BC = nC_V (P2/P1) T0 (V2/V1 - 1).
Heat added Q_BC = ΔU_BC + W_BC.
Segment CD is an isochoric process with constant volume V = V2 and pressure changes from P2 to P1.
For an isochoric process, work done W_CD = 0.
Using the ideal gas law, T_D = (V2/V1) T0.
Change in internal energy ΔU_CD = nC_V (V2/V1) T0 (1 - P2/P1).
Heat released Q_CD = ΔU_CD.
Segment DA is an isobaric process with constant pressure P = P1 and volume changes from V2 to V1.
Work done on the gas W_DA = P1 (V1 - V2).
Using the ideal gas law, T_A = T0.
Change in internal energy ΔU_DA = nC_V T0 (1 - V2/V1).
Heat released Q_DA = ΔU_DA + W_DA.
